title: Keen day 2007
content:
3.14; what will *you* be doing?

It seems we have a level competition due on that day, so we'll all have something cool to play, but what have you got planed for the day ahead. (Or alternately, 3.15, Mort day.)

When Adis gets back, I'm going to restart work on my mod!

Cute bunny!

content:
I'll try to relax.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:
*looks Windows calendar*
um... it'll be wednesday. Definitely it's gonna be another common day, no special events for me.------------------

title: Re: Keen day 2007
content:
To celebrate 315, I'm gonna release all new open source Keen, with all new three episodes, with multiplayer, map editor, sprite editor and some other secret stuff [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] . It will be DX10 game, but will support also EGA and CGA emulated modes for your retro pleasure, as well as adlib sounds. It will include all original Commander Keen maps too, so you don't have to remake them onto the new engine.----

[img]http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/1923/untitled116qa.gif[/img]

title: Re: Howto Time!
content:
1. Go to the main page of the forums and click the "My Control Center" link.
2. Go to "Account Preferences".
3. Tick the box that says "Use personal icon URL" and enter the address of an image in the box below. (The image should be 10x10, but it will resize automatically)
4. Click "Save Changes" at the bottom.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Looks
content:
Well "April 31" is the day after April 30, so technically May 1 should be "European Keen Day"...

At any rate when you write the date in the international format (which is good for a number of reasons) you still end up with 2007-03-14, so in that format it's still March 14.

And back on topic yes, that level does look good. How are you going to stop the player from falling off the sides of the levels?

title: Re: f
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]And back on topic yes, that level does look good. How are you going to stop the player from falling off the sides of the levels?[hr][/quote]
i use a mod [sp2d] that fixes the players movement to the Y-axis so the player is always on the same Y-axis coordinates thus making the gameplay 2d while the level is 3d

but to play my level you need oldshool amp'd and sp2d
oldskool is a neat mod if you have the original unreal you can play unreal inside unreal tournament

[url=http://www.usaar33.com/filez_main.html]www.usaar33.com/filez_main.html[/url]
[site of the maker of oldskool amp'd]

[url=http://bsoft.net.ua/kea/index.html]bsoft.net.ua/kea/index.html[/url]
[the sp2d site][url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]
As it turns out, I've got an appointment with the Department of Motor Vehicles on March 14th... Never a fun experience.
